title: Quotient of an abelian category
summary: In mathematics, the quotient (also called Serre quotient or Gabriel quotient) of an abelian category A {\displaystyle {\mathcal {A}}} by a Serre subcategory B {\displaystyle {\mathcal {B}}} is the abelian category A / B {\displaystyle {\mathcal {A}}/{\mathcal {B}}} which, intuitively, is obtained from A {\displaystyle {\mathcal {A}}} by ignoring (i.e. treating as zero) all objects from B {\displaystyle {\mathcal {B}}} .  There is a canonical exact functor Q : A â†’ A / B {\displaystyle Q\colon {\mathcal {A}}\to {\mathcal {A}}/{\mathcal {B}}} whose kernel is B {\displaystyle {\mathcal {B}}} , and A / B {\displaystyle {\mathcal {A}}/{\mathcal {B}}} is in a certain sense the most general abelian category with this property.
